architecture.definition: The fundamental structural organization of a software system, including its components, relationships, and governing principles.

module.definition: A discrete, self-contained functional unit within the larger system, with defined interfaces and responsibilities.

version.definition: A specific state or iteration of the platform, representing a point in its evolutionary timeline.

interfaceLayer.definition: The presentation and interaction boundary between users and the underlying system logic.

dataStructure.definition: The organized format in which information is stored, accessed, and manipulated within the system.

logicEngine.definition: The computational core responsible for processing business rules and algorithmic operations.

stateManagement.definition: The systematic coordination and persistence of application state across components and user sessions.

dependency.definition: A relationship where one module relies on another to function correctly.

schema.definition: A formal definition of data organization, types, and constraints.

structuralNeutrality.definition: A design approach that prioritizes architectural clarity over aesthetic or branding considerations.

modularTransparency.definition: The principle of making system components and their relationships explicitly visible and understandable.

framework.definition: A foundational structure that supports and organizes the development and operation of a system.

whatIs.title: What is LexOrbital?
whatIs.paragraph1: LexOrbital is a conceptual framework for visualizing and understanding software architecture as a modular, evolving system. It provides a structural approach to mapping how digital platforms are constructed, how their components interact, and how they transform across versions.
whatIs.paragraph2: Rather than focusing on visual design or branding, LexOrbital V1 emphasizes the architectural foundation—the skeletal structure that supports all subsequent iterations and enhancements.
whatIs.paragraph3: This platform demonstrates how technical systems can be represented in pure structural terms, making complex architectures comprehensible through minimal, schematic interfaces.

structuralClarity.title: Structural Clarity
structuralClarity.description: Establish a neutral, non-decorative foundation that prioritizes architectural understanding over aesthetic expression.

modularTransparency.title: Modular Transparency
modularTransparency.description: Make visible the relationships between discrete functional modules and their roles within the larger system.

versionAwareness.title: Version Awareness
versionAwareness.description: Create infrastructure for tracking and comparing architectural evolution across multiple platform versions.

documentationIntegration.title: Documentation Integration
documentationIntegration.description: Unify technical, legal, and ethical documentation within the same structural framework as the functional architecture.
